metadata.title: CVE-2018-1089 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
389-ds-base before versions 1.4.0.9, 1.3.8.1, 1.3.6.15 did not properly handle long search filters with characters needing escapes, possibly leading to buffer overflows. A remote, unauthenticated attacker could potentially use this flaw to make ns-slapd crash via a specially crafted LDAP request, thus resulting in denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-1089` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.3.8.2-1
389-ds-base - 1.3.8.2-1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.3.8.2-1
cockpit-389-ds - 1.3.8.2-1
python3-lib389 - 1.3.8.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.8.2-1').
